Company Short Description: Contentful is a cloud-based headless content management system (CMS) founded in 2013 in Berlin, Germany. The company has expanded globally, with significant operations in San Francisco, and serves over 4,000 organizations, including 30% of Fortune 500 companies. Contentful has achieved a $3 billion valuation following a $175 million Series F funding round led by Tiger Global.The platform offers an API-first headless CMS that decouples content creation from presentation, allowing for delivery across websites, mobile apps, IoT devices, and other digital channels. It features a composable content platform that includes tools for content modeling and collaboration, an orchestration layer, and a marketplace for pre-built integrations. Contentful supports over 110 billion API calls monthly and provides developer-centric tools to streamline content synchronization and deployment. The platform is designed for agility, enabling cross-regional teams to work in parallel and integrate easily with over 100 apps and services.

Company Short Description: Camunda is a process automation company based in Berlin, Germany, founded in 2008. It focuses on business and IT process automation, offering a collaborative and scalable platform for organizations across various industries, including financial services, insurance, telecom, retail, manufacturing, tech, and the public sector.The core product, Camunda Platform, includes tools for designing processes, monitoring workflows, and managing tasks. It integrates with technologies like APIs, RPA bots, microservices, IoT devices, machine learning, and AI. Camunda Cloud, launched in 2020, provides a cloud-native solution for workflow automation. The company also enhances its offerings with advanced process mining technology through its acquisition of Process Analytics Factory in 2021.Camunda serves a diverse clientele, including notable companies like Goldman Sachs, Zalando, and T-Mobile. With a global community of over 100,000 developers, Camunda promotes an open-source approach to process automation. The company has experienced significant growth, surpassing $100 million in Annual Recurring Revenue and expanding its workforce to over 130 employees.
